group_1.narration: Even back then, Rena knew she was the one at fault.
But she just got stubborn...and then it felt like@she couldn't back down anymore.
That's how out of sorts I was.
Even though Rena was the one at fault, and no matter@how angry Rena got, Kaede would still chase after her,@catch her, and apologize.
And yet, Rena got so mad she even tried using one@of those urban legends to break off their friendship.
Kaede did what I really wanted to do...but I couldn't admit that.@There was no way I could've stayed calm when@my heart was such a mixed-up mess.
But while all that was going on, me and@the others got dragged into the [textBlue:Rumor].
Like the urban legend about ending friendships actually came true,@Kaede got taken by the "Friendship Ending Staircase"...!
So we all went looking for Kaede together.
Somewhere deep down, Rena just assumed@everyone was blaming her for everything.
Honestly, none of this would've happened if not for me@writing Kaede's name on the Friendship Ending Staircase...
Then, while we were looking for Kaede, someone@suggested that apologizing could lure out the enemy...@So Rena ended up doing just that.
Back then, Rena couldn't really get herself@to say that she wanted to make up.
I knew I'd gone too far...but it was also true@that Kaede had really gotten on my nerves.
...Still, if Kaede didn't turn up then@I'd end up looking like the bad guy.
My heart was such a huge mess, I couldn't even tell@what I was honestly feeling anymore.
But there was one thing Rena knew for sure.@She didn't want Kaede to disappear...
Really, I know I'm a pretty troublesome person.
So I said, "I'm sorry for making you my friend,"@and that's when the [textBlue:Rumor] decided to show up.
That was probably when Rena finally stopped lying to herself...@and began to face her true feelings head-on.
